channel.title: Good mixboard program?
channel.description: Hey guys, I really wanna learn more about using mix boards (program ones of course) and I can't really find any good ones out there that are free. Does anyone know any? I really want to get into making techno and dub steps =D Thanks - Andrew

item.title: Good mixboard program?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:9, topic:387495”]you should be able to get a torrent of fruity loops anywhere.[/quote]This.

But I suggest you check other softwares as well. From this community, the thing I’ve learned the most is that you’re only successful if you have to motivation to learn some things by yourself. Do some research, there are many alternatives. Ableton and Sony acid are two incredibly designed audio producing softwares. Plus, you’ll notice later as you use FL Studio that the channels sometimes blend or mash together. FL isn’t too good at defining channels individually.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Saphire`:

If I can find my old hard drive I’ll rip all the sound files out of there that are paid for and give them to you if you’d like, but don’t hold me onto that because I have no idea where my old HDD is.

Ok, thank you very much for even considering it =D

[quote=“Saphire`, post:4, topic:387495”]I wouldn’t rush into it though, take time to learn a few things and follow tutorials on youtube.

It can get confusing.[/quote]
Don’t worry I wont, Ill probably spend like an hour a day learning cause I have always wanted to do stuff like this .
